KnowledgeBase.Title: compareNE
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes: String Symbol Structure Dictionary Matrix Number Date Function Lambda Directory Vector Brick Boolean Pair List Void Character Complex NumMatrix FltVector ShortVector IntVector NumVector ObjVector BitVector ObjectRepository
KnowledgeBase.DataType: String Symbol Structure ShortVector Dictionary Directory Vector Complex Lambda List Brick Matrix Void Boolean Character Number Date CpxVector Function Pair FltVector IntVector NumVector ObjVector BitVector ObjectRepository NumMatrix
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: compare compareEQ compareGT compareGE compareLT compareLE

Function.Description: The compareNE function compares two objects of the same Data Type and determines whether both objects are equal or not. A Boolean value is returned.

Brief.Overview: The compareNE is the comparison function that can be used with this Data Type. The resulting value is a Boolean value of true or false.
Brief.Overview-ObjectRepository: The compareNE is the comparison function that can be used with this Data Type. The resulting value is a Boolean value of true or false. The Object Repository files and NOT the file names are compared.
Brief.Overview-Void: The compareNE is the comparison functions that can be used with native data types and Heap objects. The resulting value is a Boolean value of true or false. The #void constant will always be less than any other value.
Brief.Usage: Use the compareNE function when you wish to compare two objects of the same Data Type and determine if they are not equal and you wish the result to be expressed as a Boolean value (true or false). The alternative comparison function,compare, only determines if two objects are equal, less than or greater than.

Argument.Name: string1
Argument.Note: The first String to be compared

Argument.Name: string2
Argument.Note: The second String to be compared

Syntax-String.Return: Returns true if the both Strings are not equal and false is both Strings are not equal.

Argument.Name: sym1
Argument.Note: The first Symbol to be compared

Argument.Name: sym2
Argument.Note: The second Symbol to be compared

Syntax-Symbol.Return: Returns true if the both Symbols are not equal and false is both Symbols are not equal.

Argument.Note: First object to be compared. Must be a native data type.
Argument.AISTypes: Void Boolean Character Number Date Function Complex

Argument.Note: Second object to be compared. Must be a native data type.
Argument.AISTypes: Void Boolean Character Number Date Function Complex

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the both Objects are not equal and false is both Objects are not equal.
